channel.title: Resize image in a table
channel.description:
I want to make several tables and put an image in it. The problem is that the images are too big to fit in the tables. So how can i resize the image so it'll fit in the tables(or make the tables bigger and the images a lil smaller) Also if you click on one of the image's i want it to pop up with the picture in full size.
So can anyone post a code sample here?

item.title: Resize image in a table
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:10, topic:256421”]Not really, you just do it once, and store it as a seperate image.

Btw, original poster guy, you need a at the end of that.[/quote]I’d just do it beforehand. Unless, ofc, it’s an image upload dealio.

Read full topic

item.title: Resize image in a table
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Not really, you just do it once, and store it as a seperate image.

Btw, original poster guy, you need a at the end of that.

Read full topic

item.title: Resize image in a table
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:7, topic:256421”]If you are going to resize on the server, with PHP, you can use the GD library for manipulating images:

http://us.php.net/gd[/quote]If the site ever gets popular, which probably not, that would put a huge load on the server.

Read full topic

item.title: Resize image in a table
item.dc:creator: @Ske Ske
item.description:
@Ske wrote:

I have no knowledge of javascript so i went with what fastbawlz said.
(my knowledge of html and css are pretty limited too :o )

Everything worked fine until i noticed my menu was gone?
if i add

the menu just disappears.
I used z-index but that didn’t help either.

Anyone know how to solve this problem?

oh and the code i used was something like this

Read full topic

item.title: Resize image in a table
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

If you are going to resize on the server, with PHP, you can use the GD library for manipulating images:

http://us.php.net/gd

Read full topic

item.title: Resize image in a table
item.dc:creator: @Exception1 Exception_
item.description:
@Exception1 wrote:

There are only two ways to dynamically do it, server side (by checking the image size) and like Ollie said, JS.

There’s no HTML to magically resize the picture and table slightly depending on what it thinks you want.

Read full topic

item.title: Resize image in a table
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

javascript?

function resizeImage(image, maxwidth, maxheight) { image.width = maxwidth; image.height = maxheight; }

but as mopman says, would be better to physically resize image to save on bandwidth.

Read full topic

item.title: Resize image in a table
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

[quote=“FastBawlz, post:3, topic:256421”]

(Keep the width and heigh proportional to the original though)[/quote]

Will work, but ideally you want to actually resize the image, be that manually or with some kind of thumbnail script. (Bandwidth)

Read full topic

item.title: Resize image in a table
item.dc:creator: @FastBallz FastBawlz
item.description:
@FastBallz wrote:

(Keep the width and heigh proportional to the original though)

Read full topic

item.title: Resize image in a table
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

You could do it with php, or you could have a small version of the images and big versions.
Just use MS paint or GIMP to make them smaller.

Read full topic
